subclusters.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes evolved programmatic mechanisms driven by antagonistic pleiotropy and evolutionary physiology, fitting the evolutionary programmatic aging theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetically programmed lifespan, systemic orchestration via hormonal clocks, and stem cell decline, consistent with evolutionary programmed aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Driven Phenoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on programmed death (phenoptosis) driven by mitochondrial ROS and genetic control of accelerated senescence, a distinct mitochondrial ROS-based programmed aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetic and cellular programming of aging including telomere shortening and antagonistic pleiotropy, aligning with evolutionary programmatic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits aging as an evolved, adjustable program with evolutionary advantages, fitting the evolutionary programmatic senescence cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses programmed aging as an evolutionary trait with molecular mechanisms, clearly within evolutionary programmatic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic and epigenetic programming of aging as a regulated process, consistent with evolutionary programmatic senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Programmatic Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic determinants of lifespan and polygenic control, supporting the evolutionary programmatic aging framework.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmental Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links aging to continuation of developmental programs via epigenetic clocks and polycomb regulation, defining a developmental programmatic aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmental Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Also focuses on methylation clocks and developmental biology driving aging, fitting the developmental programmed aging cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuronal Nutrient-Sensing Regulation of Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights nutrient-sensing neurons and neuronal signaling pathways controlling lifespan and metabolic regulation, a distinct neuronal nutrient-sensing program.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF/Wnt Signaling Crosstalk Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IGF and Wnt signaling crosstalk in satellite cells regulating aging, a specific signaling pathway-based programmed aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF1-p53-SIRT1 Axis Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IGF1 signaling inducing senescence via p53 and SIRT1, linking cellular senescence to aging, a specific molecular axis in programmed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging regulation by a network of nutrient sensors (AMPK, mTOR, IIS, sirtuins), integrating metabolic and environmental signals.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on calorie restriction modulating nutrient-sensing pathways like IGF-1 and mTOR to slow aging, fitting nutrient sensing network mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes dietary restriction and amino acid sensing pathways regulating lifespan, consistent with nutrient sensing network cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on caloric restriction effects via TOR and sirtuin pathways regulating metabolism and aging, fitting nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes sirtuin-mediated calorie restriction effects on lifespan and stress resistance, a key component of nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on conserved longevity pathways IIS, mTOR, and PKA signaling modulated genetically or pharmacologically, fitting nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic control of aging via insulin/IGF-1 signaling and modulation by caloric restriction, consistent with nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Sir2-family protein activation by calorie restriction as a conserved mechanism slowing aging, part of nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SIR2/Sirtuin regulation linking metabolism to aging and mediating calorie restriction effects, fitting nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes conserved genetic pathways including IIS and TOR regulating longevity, consistent with nutrient sensing network cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing Network Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses yeast model to study conserved genetic and signaling pathways regulating aging, fitting nutrient sensing network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF1 Signaling and Caloric Restriction Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IGF-1 receptor modulation by caloric restriction affecting protein synthesis and aging, a specific IGF1 signaling mechanism.
